article.title: Welcome to the U.S. Export Assistance Center of Indianapolis
article.summary: Learn about the Indianapolis U.S. Export Assistance Center.
article.content:
​​Why Should Small Businesses Export Now? Video​

Welcome to the U.S. Export Assistance Center (USEAC) of Indianapolis. The U.S. Commercial Service of the U.S. Department of Commerce is a federal government agency dedicated to helping small and medium sized companies with U.S. export sales and marketing. The U.S. Export Assistance Center in Indianapolis is part of a large domestic and international network consisting of over 250 offices in 82 countries designed to support U.S. international business development needs. Our offices are directly linked with our overseas establishments located in the U.S. Embassies and Consulates.

We are located in Indianapolis - the largest populous city in Indiana. Our office is a small, high-activity center with a staff of highly experienced trade specialists, led by our director, Mark Cooper. We serve the highly diverse and multi-cultural business community of Indianapolis.

We embody the goals of the mission statement of the US Commercial Service. For more information on how we can help your company with its exporting strategies, please visit our services.

​Contact Information

For more information, please contact us at:

11405 North Pennsylvania Street
Carmel, Indiana 46032
Tel: (317) 582-2300
Fax: (317) 582-2301

For individual Trade Specialists,click here.


Indiana Global Overview

  • Ranked 13th in the nation in exports
  • $32.3 billion in exports in 2011
  • 6,500 companies export goods from Indiana
  • Exports support 7% of Indiana's private sector employment
  • 1 in 5 Indiana manufacturing jobs supported by exports​​​
